thread.title: Angola: SME Step Up Fight Against Illegal Stay in Cabinda
thread.title_full: Angola: SME Step Up Fight Against Illegal Stay in Cabinda

title: Angola: SME Step Up Fight Against Illegal Stay in Cabinda
text:
Nigeria: How Telecom Firms Made N690 Billion From Mast Sales 
Cabinda — At least 146 foreign citizens from the neighbouring Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) and Congo Brazzaville were detained from 3 to 10 this month in northern Cabinda province over illegal stay, announced the Migration and Foreigner Department (SME). 
This is contained in a note delivered to Angop on Friday, adding that the joint action carried out in cooperation with other operative bodies is part of strict and permanent fight against illegal migration in the region. 
Of the 146 detainees, 144 are from DRC - 86 men and 58 women, while the remaining two, a couple, are from the Congo Brazzaville. Angola
